snippet: A Milwaukee County jury said Badger Guns must pay more than $5 million to two officers wounded by a man wielding a pistol that he had illegally gotten a friend to buy for him at the shop.
abstract: Jury awards more than $5 million in damages to Milwaukee police officers Bryan Norberg and Graham Kunisch, who were grievously wounded with pistol that local gun store sold to straw buyer in 2009; cops were shot by 18-year-old Julius Burton shortly following gun purchase; court case dealt with responsibility of gun sellers for criminal use of their products.
lead_paragraph: A Milwaukee County jury said Badger Guns must pay more than $5 million to two officers wounded by a man wielding a pistol that he had illegally gotten a friend to buy for him at the shop.

headline.print_headline: Two Officers Were Shot; Store Liable for Gun Sale
headline.main: Two Officers Were Shot; Wisconsin Store Liable for Gun Sale
